Granted, it was peak hours. But if margaritas are the daily special well then...probably need to kick out quite a few.

Really good food. My wife and I ate here today for lunch and unlike some of the other reviews got great food and service. I ordered the country fried steak with a side of chili and mashed potatoes. My wife ordered the chicken and dumplings and i was impressed by both meals. Both were made in house fresh to order and came out steaming. The cook actually brought the food out and everyone seemed concerned whether we like it or not which we loved. Our waitress was awesome and never left are drinks empty. For such a good meal and getting out of there only spending 26 dollars including tip i think that this is a wonderful spot to grab a meal.

Have been here several times with the office for our weekly lunch together. I really like the quesadillas even though they are not what the restaurant is known for. Their salsa is also pretty good. Service is usually fast but note that they cannot seat partial parties so be sure to arrive with everyone in tow!

My favorite place in plaza midwood to eat. I go there as often as I can for the always delicious food and great atmosphere. The staff in my opinion is the best in the city. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a delicious experience with great service.

I saw this restaurant featured on Diners Drive Ins and Dives and decided to give it a try. It was a beautiful day so we decided to sit out back on the patio. We started with drinks; I ordered the Ice Pick which was sweet tea, vodka, and lemon juice. It was a very good drink and at $4.00 it just can't be beat. My husband ordered the SoCo and lime it was also good and $4.00. We ordered the Collard Dip for an appetizer. This was the highlight of the meal a perfect balance of creamy salty and bitter on lightly toasted pita triangles; it also came with tortilla chips. I ordered the chicken and dumplings with potato salad for my side. The chicken and dumplings were the best I have had, they were not bland at all; black pepper, onion and garlic all flavored the thick broth. There was lots of shredded chicken and small tender pieces of dumpling. It also came with a tender, flaky, golden brown biscuit and a tasty deviled egg. The potato salad was good not great. My Husband ordered the salmon cakes they were good but nothing special. They did come with an orange honey butter on top and that was delish as well as two sides. The mac and cheese was kind of bland and greasy. The mashed sweet potatoes were nicely seasoned with butter, sugar and cinnamon. The service was quick and attentive. If it were not for the salmon cakes and the mac and cheese I would have given this place five stars.

Dish is my standby.  My boyfriend and I live in the Plaza Midwood area and we hit Dish about twice a week.  It is all delicious, and the specials are usually awesome!  Can't go wrong with old faithful shrimp and grits, or the honey glazed biscuits.  The drink specials are usually quite a steal and are worth asking about.  Best of all, local art adorns the wall and it changes regularly.  If you have the same experience I have had, you'll get great, friendly service and tasty eats each time!

Dish was definitely a Charlotte destination after seeing it on TV. Chicken and dumplins is one of my favorite Southern dishes, so how could I pass up an opportunity to partake of it at a DDD eatery?  The food is affordable, the vibe is casual, and the service is great. They also have a nice variety of alcohol to choose from. They do local beers, a few wines, and some mixed drinks; just enough to pair with your simple grub.  Dish's menu is fairly straightforward, with mostly Southern dishes and a handful of unique options. I went with the C&D with a side of macaroni and cheese. Every dish comes with a biscuit and a deviled egg.  The deviled egg was somewhat bland, but creamy. The biscuit was very buttery and soft on the inside, but it was a bit dry on the exterior. The macaroni and cheese was really creamy, but it lacked a cheesy and hearty flavor.  The poultry and pastry was disappointing. The dumplings were extremely tough, almost doughy, and the little amount of chicken in the stew was somewhat bland. I enjoyed the well-seasoned stew a lot, but the stuff inside was sub-par.  The bourbon-vanilla sweet potato pie was pretty good and unique. It was a thick and tall slice with a pecans and glaze on top with a really rich and sweet crust. I wish the crust was a little less gummy and sweet and more crumbly. The flavor of the filling itself was spot on.  This joint definitely offers some classic Southern fare,  but the preparation and textures could use some work. I went at an off-time, so maybe I caught the bad end of the kitchen, but I did not think my meal was particularly special.
If you can find a restaurant that caters more to vegans and non-vegans alike, be my guest. The food is great, the prices are even better, and it feels like home. Don't miss this spot.

The dish is simply fantastic. Prices are mind blowing for both the quality and the portion. The new breakfast option keeps that same theme and is deliciously simple. Bloody mary bar is fun on saturdays. Potato cake appetizer could serve as a whole meal. Although the place is consistently busy during prime dining hours, service is always solid. Chicken and dumplings are the tits. Its places like these that make plaza midwood the coolest 2 miles in town.

Dish has pretty great food I have tried the chicken and dumplings awesome.  The black bean nachos great. The salmon patties mediocre. The potato poppers awesome. The chicken sandwich is also great. Service there is always pretty good. Just don't go for scenery it's not so great.
Food was awesome I had the catfish, so flakie and fresh. Great bisket and soup of the day just a little spicy like it like!!!

One of my family members recommended I try this place so I was excited to give it try. The service was good and our waitress was very nice, but one of the kitchen workers was talking loudly using very profane language throughout our entire meal. This was very unprofessional. To top it off we found a hair in the food. They gave the meal for free, but it's still hard to have a positive opinion after the bad language and hair found.

Went here a few years ago for the first time, and tried it again about 2 weeks ago and it was exactly like I remembered: Meh... Food was under seasoned and was just ok. The kicker for me was the Vanilla Bourbon Sweet Potato Pie...it was bland and not sweet at all for a dessert. After tasting it 2 times and mentioning it to the waitress, she only apologized and did nothing more. I mentioned it to another staff member who said that their policy is "As long as it's cooked properly, then there's nothing we can do"....all the while another employee stood there rolling her eyes at me and my complaint.  I'm sure it's a great place and decent people work there...but all of this over a $4 dessert? That's silly to lose a customer over but they've certainly lost me. I would have tried it a 3rd time even with the lack of seasoning, but it's not worth it after not taking a tasteless, $4 dessert off of my bill.

My Wife and I have been to Dish at least 20 times. They serve Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner. It's mostly Comfort Food with a Twist, and includes Vegan, and Vegetarian selections. They also have a Full Bar in the back. We haven't had a bad meal yet. The atmosphere is pleasant, and the staff are friendly, and good at their jobs. The food prices are VERY fair, and the portions are more than enough. You won't leave hungry.   Some of our favorites for starters are the Fried Green Tomatoes, The Parmesan Potato Poppers, and the Cajun Meatloaf Sliders. My Wife Raves about the Soups, and the Grilled Eggplant Pita. My Personal Favorites are the Chicken and Dumplings, Shrimp and Grits, and the Cajun Meatloaf w/Mashed Potatoes. They also have a GREAT breakfast in the $5-6 Dollar Range. Their Bacon ROCKS !  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that likes good food, and good service, for an affordable price.

Yummmmm!  Had the BLT with a fried egg.  Kale and chickpea salad side.  Omg. So much yum.  Came here on recommendation from a local friend.  Absolutely worth it.  Great service.  Delicious food.  Prices are SO REASONABLE!!! Bloody Mary is very good.  Check it out!!

The chicken and dumplings are out of this world. 10/10 would recommend them. Usually get a biscuit and deviled egg on the side which is honestly the best part. Both are sooo good.   The staff here are warm and the atmosphere is cozy. No thrills, southern cooking. Never ran into a wait here and usually don't have to wait long for the food either.   They also have a make your own Bloody Mary station which is pretty cool - if you like them, which turns out I do not

Love you guys! Not once have I come in and felt like I was at just another restaurant ordering from just another server. Every time I'm come in, you guys make me feel welcome like going to a friends house. The servers never make me feel rushed as if there's another table they have to get to. It's a fun environment and makes me feel at home. The food is great! I love how when I'm there that I feel like I'm part the neighborhood. Thanx guys for being great!

Good soul food with a twist at a good price. I've ate lunch/dinner here a few times.  Huge selection of veggies and sides. The biscuits are very good. Service is always good, very prompt and knowledgeable. Good vibe in the restaurant.

The service was great! Green tomatoes and potato poppers were tasty appetizers. We shared a pot roast with mac and cheese and side salad. The pot roast was so flavorful, the mashed potatoes were a great side, and the mac and cheese was delicious!

Man I wish yelp allows us to give half stars (are you listening yelp corp?) but I would give Dish 3.5 stars. I have been wanting to go to Dish for years and today I finally got the opportunity. We came in for lunch and there was an amplitude of seating available. We are some hungry folks and ordered quite a bit of stuff. Here's the low down:  Apps: Fried Green Tomatoes - I'm a big fan of fried green tomatoes and these were just a-ok. A bit sour than what I would like but the horseradish sauce really balanced it out.  Entrees: Chicken & Dumplings: My favorite out of the 3 entrees that we tried. It tasted very homey; just like how grandma would make it. I wished it had a bit of veggies in it (like carrots and celery chunks). If it did, it would be on point. Country Fried Steak: Not the best that I've had but it was pretty good. The gravy made the dish and the mashed potatoes that accompanied the dish still had potato skins in it (kudos point!). Shrimp & Grits: My least favorite out of the 3. I love myself some shrimp and grits and someone was just off. The grits taste bland and not very creamy. I always finish my food (and I wasn't able to) so I was a bit disappointed.  All entrees came with a deviled egg (yum) and a biscuit (even yummier!). Some of the entrees came with side dishes and we tried the mac & cheese and collard greens. They tasted alright; nothing to write home about.  Would I come again? Maybe when Charlotte runs out of option for southern food and I doubt that will happen anytime soon.  While the food tasted good, it was nothing special and we all know that Charlotte has a lot more to offer.

I've been to Dish for both dinner and breakfast, and I have to say I prefer them for breakfast.  The prices are very reasonable for how much food you get, and I enjoy the laid-back atmosphere and 60s and 70s music during breakfast.   Dinner gets 3.5 stars.  The black eyed pea hummus is an interesting concept, but the hummus was too thick to be able to scoop it out of the bowl with just a pita wedge - a fork was definitely needed here!  It was also very filling.  Their chicken and dumplings (made famous from an episode of Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives) could have used more dumplings and less chicken.  (I know, I'm probably the only person who would think that.)  The gravy was quite thick, and I am not a fan of dark meat, so I probably won't get it again.  Their mac 'n cheese was quite good, though, as were their biscuits and deviled eggs.    My hubby is a real fan of salmon patties, and he liked their version.  He also enjoyed their collards and squash casserole.  Their breakfast is a real bargain, and they have become one of our favorite places for Saturday breakfast, so they deserve 5 stars for this meal.  I always get the Downhome breakfast served with eggs, hash brown casserole or grits, bacon, sausage, or soy sausage, biscuit, and tea or coffee.  Everything is always good, and the hash brown casserole is really unique and tasty (it's made with cream and cheddar cheeses, onions, and it's yummy!).  And all this is just $5!    My hubby usually gets the Carolina Country breakfast, which has BOTH grits and the hash brown casserole, and also a bowl of pepper gravy for $6.50.  The gravy is peppery, just the right consistency, and really good on the biscuit and eggs.  You'll usually see Yolanda at breakfast, and she's one of our all-time favorite servers.  She always has a smile, she remembers your order if you are a regular, and when she has control of the music, you are guaranteed a great start to your day.  The coffee is even strong enough to satisfy us.  Service is also usually quick and attentive.  I only wish they would open earlier than 10am for breakfast!

When traveling, I like to venture to at least 1 DDD restaurant. 9pm on a Tuesday, I walked in Dish and was seated quickly and then...speediest service I've ever had in my life. Like, quicker than fast food drive-thru service. It kinda scared me actually, but after I tried a spoonful of the chicken-and-dumplings, I was fine. Listen, yum yum love. I didn't need to add a sprinkle of salt or pepper, which most places lack on. There were too many sides to choose from, so I decided to go with the mashed sweet potatoes. They could've used a bit more cinnamon though, problem solved after I asked for some and they delivered. Unfortunately, it seems like I was too late in the day to try the famed deviled eggs, but the biscuit was great and whatever they use to top it compliments it quite well.   I'm a fan and I will definitely be back next time I'm in Charlotte.
That meat loaf is oh SO good :) I also had the zucchini casserole for the side... yum!

I pass through Charlotte at least a couple times per year, typically around the holidays, and usually meet up with friends to grab a bite to eat.  Tonight, we ended up in Plaza Midwood (a small neighborhood with trendy eateries) at Dish.  Dish is a casual Southern restaurant with a laid back atmosphere, friendly staff, and reasonably priced food.  The restaurant has a bit of an old school Southern feel to it with its small wooden tables and chairs, vinyl tablecloths, and retro signage and decor.  The menu features Southern staples such as chicken and dumplings, meatloaf, shrimp and grits, and a pot roast.  They also serve Mexican items (burritos and quesadillas) and sandwiches.  I was drawn to their BBQ sliders appetizer because it included three sliders with a choice of three sauces: eastern NC (vinegar based), SC (mustard based), and "Chicago" (sweet tomato based).  I asked for one slider with each sauce.  Each slider had pulled pork with the sauce poured on top, inside of a biscuit with a pickle on top.  The plate was served with a small sample of Carolina-style cole slaw (vinegar, no mayo).  There was not as much meat as I hoped and while the biscuits were good, there was too high of a bread-to-meat ratio for my liking.  Like other Southern restaurants, Dish offers vegetable plates.  Each vegetable plate comes with a biscuit, glazed on top with honey, and a deviled egg.  I tried the mac and cheese, squash casserole, and mashed sweet potatoes.  The noodles in the mac and cheese were your typical small sized mac and cheese noodles (like you make at home).  Good texture and not too oily.  Squash casserole tasted homemade (in a good way).  Not a huge fan of the mashed sweet potatoes, but you could tell they were freshly mashed sweet potatoes and not processed.  Check out my photos to see the food.  Our server was Mollie and she provided good service.  The food came out fast.  The restaurant has a bar in the back and also has a bunch of unique paintings.  Not sure if they are for sale, but they were interesting to look at.  There's plenty of free parking in the open lot across the street from the entrance.

Delish Dish and charming as can be...  Food and portions were great! I had fried green tomatoes that were perfect. Crispy and golden brown.  The chicken and dumplings were so comforting and had tons of perfectly seasoned chicken.  One complaint is the home made biscuit served on the side of my meal was dry. They could be warmed up a little :)  I will definitely go back.

Parking is a bit of a challenge but not worse than you would expect from a restaurant located in an urban neighborhood.  The interior is eclectic and consistent with the ambiance expected in this price range.  The Spicy Meatloaf was good but all the spice came from the gravy, not the meatloaf itself so the dish was not well balanced.  The Mac and Cheese was tasty but not creamy, that is a personal preference thing. I also had the lemonade which wasn't bad at all.  It took 40 minutes to be served lunch which was disappointing because we were quite late getting back to the office.  Final Verdict: Great flavor for the buck, make sure you have time!

Best food ever! All good items on the menu has lots of flavor ... a must try.  I love their deviled eggs and biscuits - so tasty and you don't want to stop eating those.  It looks typical down town look from outside but thy have great service and the food is a must try.  Thumbs up!
I had the chicken and dumplings with mashed sweet potatoes. The food was super yummy - the perfect hangover cure. The staff were really friendly and attentive.

Dish has all the home style comfort food you could dream of! With reasonable prices and delicious options, it's hard to pass up. My fave is the 3 Veggie Plate that allows you to pick and choose 3 of their sides as your meal with a biscuit and deviled egg.

My partner and I went to outlet shopping after we starve and find something to eat. We supposed to eat inside but we chose to take our food to go due of parking. It was very difficult to find parking. It was very small it took us 15 minutes to drive around. No lucky. We took our risk to park in front of that restaurant for 15 minutes parking. We hurried and went in to make order.  My partner, she had cajun spicy meatloaf with potatoes and I had country fried steak wit potato, we both have sides on mac cheese. We have free biscuit and devil eggs. Food great! Atmosphere great! Service fast and great! I gave 4 stars is because of hard to find parking. I had seen other people have the same problem. We will come back again.

The atmosphere and service are always good.  Food is usually delightful. The meatloaf is a favorite of mine.  I also like brunch, it comes with a lot of food and coffee/tea. I like it here. Will go back.
Very eclectic place. Hipster dive feal, with good home cooking. Pork Chops and Meatloaf are always my favorites.

We decided to try this place for a nice Saturday afternoon lunch! I was very disappointed with my burger. It lacked any type of flavor. However, Kevin really enjoyed his chicken & dumplings. I probably won't try it again with all the other great restaurants in the area.

I eat here at least once a week, and here's why: it's cheap, there's always a table waiting (might be in the back, which used to be the smoking section, but is no longer), waitstaff is awesome, and the food is all about simplicity and comfort.   It doesn't matter what I'm in the mood for, there's something on the menu to satisfy my craving. Pile o' mac'n'cheese and some collards? Check. Awesome tomato soup and grilled pimento cheese? Yup. Salad with a big, tasty portabello on top? Mmm-hmm. A pile of black bean nachos with their limey-tasty salsa on the side? Aye. Starchy, chick-pea filled veggie burger? *Grab* (perfect hangover cure, in my humble opinion).   I've had copious beverages here on weekend evenings (MEL YOU RULE) but also taken my family here numerous times for fancy dinners. It's all around win, and every time I leave I'm satisfied and proud to have frequented one of the best, yet chill, restaurants in Charlotte.

The food is delicious but the servers are very unprofessional and too lackadaisical. ... even when they answer the phone  This place could really be a hit if they took a look at training the service staff....

I'm a huge fan of Southern cookin' and Dish did not disappoint one bit.  Moving to Charleston next month so we'll see how it holds up against "The Holy City's" fine southern eateries, but for now... this is some of the best I've had.  So last night's dinner at Dish easily qualifies as the best meal I've had in Charlotte under $10.  A perfectly fried country fried steak over a bed of made-from-scratch mashers, a deviled egg, and a ridiculously buttery biscuit... Yup.  Oh yea, and one extra side of choice.  For $7.99?  Done and done.  Can't wait to go back and try the pot roast and Cajun meatloaf!  UPDATE: Dish can easily rival similar establishments in Charleston, or anywhere.

My wife and I have been to Dish more times than I can count and it's always been awesome.  We brought visiting family when they were in town and now each time they come Dish is a must have. I have tried the meatloaf, chicken and dumplings, pot roast and my personal favorite the country fried steak. My least favorite dish there is the meatloaf but still it's not bad. Must try appetizers are the fried green tomatoes and the potato balls. Dish is just good old home cooking like your southern grandma would do and you get a whole dinner at really good price. If you haven't tried it I highly recommend it- without a doubt one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.

Mmmm. There's something about no frills, good down home cooking and Dish knows how to dish it up! It's just like mom's homemade cooking, but with a side of soul. Sure, Triple D has been here, and that might bring you in the first time, but the deviled eggs and the biscuits will keep bringing you back. Everything from their Cajun meatloaf to the country-fried steak is delicious, and will leave you happy and full. Always order the collards, they're probably in my top 3 of Charlotte, and you can never go wrong with a side of their deviled eggs, even if one already comes on your plate!
Excellent food. I order the Cajun meatloaf which is not something I would normally get, it was great. So was the deviled egg, biscuit , and cauliflower. I will eat here again and again .

This place was so unexpected, in a good way!  The staff was extremely friendly and outgoing!!!  Their is a wonderful outdoor seating area, it's small but comfortable with tables and umbrellas for the sun. The waitress was attentive but not hovering and the food did not disappoint!!!! I had a difficult time choosing one item but ended up with the Pimento Grilled Cheese..... HEAVEN!!!!!  WARM AND GOOEY,  oozing with flavor!!!!  I can't wait to return next time I'm in Charlotte to try something else!!!!
DISH is another one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Absolutely love their Pot Roast entree, one of the best I have ever had.

Dish is a great place to eat if you are in need of comfort food. It may be the best in town. The menu is Southern America Fusion. You get a homemade deviled egg with each entree. I have tried the chicken and dumplings and found them to be the perfect blend of soft, cream, and dumpling. I have also had the salmon cakes with honey butter. Yummie!   It's usually crowded. The decor is stylistic, like hometown diner meets East Village cool. Love it!
Just like mama made, but better!  Always good service, wonderful location. I love to sit on the patio in the warmer months! The deviled eggs are to die for!
First time at the Dish.. we tried the Parmesan Potato Poppers. They are unbelievably good. So crip outside..and yumm mashed potatoes inside.. a must try!

My husband and  I were in town for a concert, so we decided to look on the DDD list to find a local restaurant to try. Dish was close by, so we thought we'd give it a shot for lunch.   We were pleasantly surprised with both our service and the food! Their menu sported all our fave southern foods with the added bonus of their own funky little twist. Everything we ordered was fantastic (especially the fried green tomatoes), was reasonably priced, and came in a good size portion. I would recommend stopping by this place when in Charlotte! We will certainly will!
I love their chicken and dumplings, salmon patty with orange butter, homemade mashed potato!
Yum! Chicken and dumplings! So basic. So delicious. Came with a small group so we ordered a variety of dishes. Everybody devoured everything with gusto. Highly recommend this spot.

The restaurant is very charming and the service was great.  Southern cooking - and the menu is full of things I'd like to try.  I ordered the fried green tomatoes.  They arrived nice and hot.  Three were thin sliced and good, three were too thick and not quite as good.  We had an order of the potato poppers, and they were kind of bland.  I'll try again - meatloaf sliders I think, but I wouldn't order the tomatoes or the potatoes again.

Good food, good prices, good beer, good staff, good management. Doesn't get better than this. My favorites are the veggie burger w pimento cheese, the meatloaf, chicken dumplings, tomato soup, and grilled cheese. Keep being awesome, Dish!

Finally tried this place on a whim with a friend. We went and worked out and decided to grab brunch. They were featuring a Bloody Mary bar and mimosas were on special. I had the rancheros plate and was very surprised. Try not to modify your plate if possible. I don't usually eat pickled jalapeños and so glad that I tried my food with them. It made all the difference in my meal. Not a huge menu but something for everyone. Reasonable in pricing. My only negative is that the bathroom was extremely cold and it was miserable having to use the bathroom. So ladies if you have a small bladder, you might want to think twice on how many drinks you have.

Great southern food! Passed by the area during a road trip because of the reviews and was pleasantly surprised. The fried green tomatoes and pot roast sliders were great. As far as sides we particularly enjoyed the sweet potato mash and squash casserole. Super affordable and friendly staff.

Very nice place to eat, and the staff is extremely attentive. The food is DELICIOUS & they don't skimp on the portions (or conversation). However, the collard greens were a little firm & the Long Island Ice Tea was a little too sweet. Otherwise, the lemon pepper perch & blackened chicken was cooked to perfection. The topping (black eyed peas, corn & onions) on the chicken really enhanced the meal. If I didn't live hundreds of miles away, is definitely become a regular.

It's casual and southern and cave-like inside (dark). Make sure you go in with the right expectations and you will be pleasantly surprised. The cajun meatloaf sliders and fried green tomatoes are a must. I've tried a lot of different things on the menu and have not been disappointed - dumplings, salads, chicken dishes...
Really great food. The chickpea burger is great especially with pimento cheese. The collards are delicious!  I've also heard great things about the meatloaf.
Biscuits were great. Dumplings were good but not to die for.  Tomato soup was actually better than the dumplings.
I went back a second time and had the salmon patties again with green beans and sweet potatoes and was happier with that selection!

I grew up in Charlotte, but for some reason had never heard of the restaurant (what a shame). Stopped in today with my dad to grab a bite to eat for lunch and I must say I am a fan. Yes, it is a southern comfort food concept, but it doesn't feel like an outdated place. The vibe is some sort of traditional chic, hard to describe, but I like it.   Their menus is actually pretty varied plenty of vegetarian options and meat options and they had like 4 specials of the day! I ended up getting the vegetable plate with collards, kale/garbanzo salad, daily soup (ginger carrot), and mac and cheese. The plate also came with a biscuit and deviled egg. A lot of food for $8.00 and I was impressed that it was all fresh. Often when you get comfort food it is heavy and greasy, but everything here was pretty light - even the biscuit was light and fluffy!   Oh and the carrot soup I mentioned, the carrot soup was to die for...seriously. I might have to drive back down there later this evening and get a bowl or two to go!   This will be my go to place for Americana for the next few weeks! Oh and they are progressive in the causes they support, something I can get on board with!
Good service. Food was okay. Will try again.

Hands Down this has become my favorite place to grab a quick but delicious afternoon lunch.   I have so many good things to say about the Dish... lets start with their warm greeting... The Dish is one of those places... you dream about.. the staff is warm and friendly.. they greet you at the door with awesome hello's and how r ya's... they point you to your usual section or sit you where you would like. The patrons are all down to earth.. respectfully and peacefully glancing at each others selections .   The Food:- This is the serious part. The owners at the Dish take food seriously...  The menu consists of southern staples and classics with modern approaches...  I enjoy their specials and keep coming back for their staples.. their vegetables are prepared by a vegetarian and the biscuits are delicious...  ciao
Been here multiple times and have yet to be disappointed. The Collard Green Dip is exceptional!!

I love love love dish! My boyfriend and I worked within walking distance so we would always come here for dinner afterwards. I can't believe I haven't done a review yet. My favorites of theirs are their veggie loaf and their pimiento veggie burger. As for sides I love their mashed cauliflower, kale and chickpea salad (when available), and macaroni and cheese. Their hummus platter is a great appetizer and their spicy carrot soup which is a special is to die for! Can't wait to come back to Charlotte and eat here.

I liked the location area and general ambience of the restaurant. The restaurant is like the neighborhood, a mash-up of different generations, cultures and genres.  The prices online are cheaper than the actual prices in-store, which was slightly frustrating.    My girlfriend was planning on ordering Shrimp & Grits, online it was $12.39, but in store on the menu it was $15.99.  She ended up ordering the Special Flounder & Grits, which she was not happy with.  The grits were plain and unseasoned.  The flounder was fried and fine, but nothing spectacular and also came with an order of black beans.. again nothing spectacular.  Our daughter ordered a hamburger, which was also unseasoned and plain.. nothing spectacular for the price.  I ordered the veggie plate, which I liked because they tasted exactly how I would prepare them myself.  Got the collard greens, sweet potato mash, and mac & cheese.  Initially, I ordered the cauliflower, but did not like it at all and traded it for the mac & cheese.  Also, got a deviled egg which was good and a biscuit, which somebody in my family ate.. so it must have been pretty good.    Prices were kind of high considering portion sizes, but I do like how the ingredients are locally sourced and most of the menu is vegetarian friendly.. the vegetables are prepared vegan, instead of with ham hock or smoked turkey.  I would possibly go back..

Went to this place because it was featured on drive ins, diners, and dives. Cool decor/ambiance on the inside, and looks like a plain Jane diner on the outside.   Based off the show, We split the chicken and dumplings, and the pot roast. Neither were OUTSTANDING, but they were good. They did have a cool beer selection and the prices were good.  I'd go again and try something else. Pretty eclectic place.   Service was 'on point' as guy would say....
Some great southern home cooked meals.  The Chicken fried steak is awesome and so is the chicken and dumplings.  Order the dead cowboy and get a good meal.  Great stuff.

Love this place! Brunch is delicious with great prices, and the mimosas are always good. Love the huevos rancheros and the breakfast bowl. Went back for dinner and had the chicken and dumplings- it was amazing, and the biscuit was an added bonus. Can't wait to go back and try their sandwiches and the fried green tomatoes!

Perfect comfort food meal with the family tonight.  The food was excellent, well seasoned and plentiful.  The service was equally as good.  To start we had the pimento cheese with tortilla chips.  It was very good, not the best I've ever had, but very good.  For dinner, I went with the crowd favorite, chicken and dumplings, and was not disappointed...seriously tasty.  My husband had the cajun meatloaf and loved it.  All in all, we were stuffed when we left.  I will definitely be back.  You cannot beat great food at reasonable prices!

I ordered the grilled chicken livers, smoky lima beans, and salad. When the food was brought to the table there was watery blood running all over the plate. It was thoroughly disgusting. Nobody that knows anything about cooking would serve chicken livers rare. The limas were hard and had obviously been seasoned with what tasted like Liquid Smoke. The salad and deviled egg were the only part of the meal that I could eat.

Chicken fried steak is great, i highly recommend it. The prices are amazing and its very affordable for a family to eat here. Drinks are reasonable as well. Each dinner comes with a fresh biscuit and a deviled egg. All meals here are fresh and made from scratch. I highly recommend this place to anyone that loves good old American home cooking.

Our waitress was very rude We waited over an hour over lunch for a salad. When we asked to speak to the manager, Hannah, but at first she refused to come. Instead, Hannah sent the waitress back without coming to speak to us, offering a 25% discount. I explained to the waitress that I did not request a discount (I had already provided payment information prior to requesting the manager). I, again, requested to have a conversation the manager. When Hannah arrived at my table, I detailed the poor service and  the delay on food that I experienced. I also asked why she did not come speak to me when I requested her to? She explained that "This is how we do things here" (implying standard practice is to offer a discount instead of a conversation and apology). When I asked Hannah to repeat her name for me (so I could take note of it) she turned her back and walked away from me. Upon exiting the restaurant, I approached Hannah and informed her that I was aware of her name (despite her refusal to continue our conversation) and would be placing this review. Hannah then FOLLOWED ME OUTSIDE the restaurant! Hannah began to tell me that I did not  understand that the discount was standard practice. Needless to say, following a customer out of a restaurant is unprofessional and did not go well with me. In fact, following me out of the restaurant was a threatening situation, and greatly escalated the situation/  original service issue I had.  I am in the process of contacting owner, Penny Craver, to address the service issue and threatening manner of her management staff.

Our first stop in the way to work an event at the expo center. Easy to get to from the highway.  Went with the server's recommendations, chicken & dumplings. Way better than the bland PA Dutchy version! (I live there, I can say that) filling with a side of collards.  Dan liked the blackened salmon special, not too spicy for him. Served  with a dollop of avocado mash.  Didn't stick around for dessert.  They have a bar area. All their side are prepared vegetarian and they have a bunch of veg options for main dishes. I'd like to try the spicy veg loaf.   Everything served with deviled eggs. Is that a Southern thing?

Such a hot day!  My craving was for a light, chilled salad, and Dish delivered.  Fresh, crisp greens and yummy blue cheese dressing, complete with a biscuit.  So much for gluten free; I ate that biscuit and enjoyed every soft,  buttery mouthful.  We also ordered a serving of their deviled eggs as an appetizer that were riddled in unctiious creaminess.   My husband devoured his vegetable plate as well.  Decent wine and beer selections with prices that don't require one to take out a loan.  Impeccable, speedy, polite service.  What took me so long?  5 stars it is!

The best pot roast ever is here! My husband loved the meat loaf as well. I was kind of sad that there weren't any deviled eggs, but there was a good reason! They care about their customers! We had the parmesan potato bites as an appetizer, and it was strangely good - like a deep fried mashed potato. Would go there again (and hopefully next time there will be some deviled eggs!) The only complaint I will have is that the place needs a little bit of an update.

My friends (colleagues) and I went here based on the Diners, Drive ins and Dives TV Show and it's everything they said it was.  The service was fantastic.  John who said he had been with the place for four years really knew his stuff.  He offered great suggestions and was just attentive enough.    The food was great too!  Everyone had something different and we all loved what we had.  We tried their three different pies and each one was amazing!  The eclectic style of the location makes it a great place to relax, chill out and have a casual meal.  I highly recommend it!

I am not a fan, but I am not a hater either.  I fall smack inbetween.  My first impressions were not that favorable.  We walked in on a rainy Friday night and there was no structure to the entrance/hostess area.  Busy waitresses kept buzzing past us, no one greeted us for a solid 3 minutes (which is a long time to be standing in awkward land) and we weren't sure who to even tell we were looking for a table!  Finally someone came around and asked us if we wanted to be seated and immediately walked us to our table.    This place definitely has a cool 'local" flare to it and while there is nothing fancy about the decor, it does have a certain comforting aspect to it.  The menu was what I expected, southern style options and the prices were very reasonable.    I ordered the veggie plate and it was okay--a little bland but the sweet potatoes were pretty good!  The squash casserole was decent but mushy and didn't have a ton of flavor.  The black beans were pretty much gross and the biscuit wasn't anything more than a pillsbury dough biscuit from Harris Teeter.  We tried the Pimento Cheese and I have had better.  Husband got the burger, which wasn't made to order and was a pretty small patty but it was ok.  Again, nothing to rush back for.  The waitress was very friendly, the food came out pretty quickly and the overall experience was decent.  I just wouldn't make a habit of returning to Dish.  I love the location, I love the vibe and I love the prices...but I didn't leave fully satisfied from the meal.

We started off with the Fried Green Tomatoes.   Very good, served with an excellent horseradish dill sauce.   I had the Shrimp & Grits, which were very good.  My partner had the Chicken & Dumplings, which were Awesome!  Split decision on the Mac & Cheese, He liked it, I liked it more.  No debate on the Collard Greens or Homemade Biscuits....Awesome!  The Deviled Eggs were a bit disappointing.  Not bad, but compared to every thing else, they tasted like an after-thought that had been hanging around for a while.    We were told all the deserts are homemade so we got the Vanilla Bourbon Sweet Potato Pie to go.  It was a little on the sweet side, but very, very good.  The service was efficient & friendly.  We are definitely looking forward to going back again.

We really wanted a good, simple breakfast with biscuits. This place serves it without overpricing a plate of eggs and grits, and the biscuits were exactly what we wanted! (They were honey biscuits, fyi). The service was great and the atmosphere is just genuinely neighborhood feel. The decor is of country diner, and might seem dated, but I found it to be charming.

So, Dish has been on my list for years, almost as long as 10 years, and I finally made it this past weekend.  And, to be honest, I only wanted to go there for the Chicken and Dumplings, which SO many people have raved about it. So, we stopped in Saturday afternoon and were seated inside on the upper level.  I was a little surprised at how casual and laid back the place was..I guess I am not sure what I expected. Needless to say I asked if I could get a cup of Chicken and Dumplings, no, only comes in a bowl, bummer.  Knowing it was heavy I was hesitate to order an entire bowl. After being persuaded, and reminded this was the reason I came, I ordered the Chicken and Dumplings with Lima Beans.  My friend ordered the Fried Egg and Bason sandwich, and asked for it on a croissant, which we found out was a $1.50 up charge.  Didn't realize that until the bill came.  Needless to say while we waited for our food we hit the Bloody Mary Bar...which I am not too sure I would call it a bar. On a high rise table they had celery salt, worsterchire, tabasco, and a few other seasonings and a ice box with celery, olives and onions. No bacon, shrimp, or anything other fun Bloody Mary bar treats.  The Bloody Marys were good though, and only $5.00. Our food arrived quickly which was nice. My meal came with a biscuit and deviled egg, which I would not bother to add as they weren't that great. My biscuit was hard so I just dove in the Chicken and Dumplings, which was great. The chicken was so moist and the dumplings were really good.  It was worth it for that bowl!  The Egg and Bacon sadwich got great reviews as well and their croissants are homemade so my friend loved.  Overall, I am glad I made a visit to Dish, but not sure I would rush back or keep this on my go to list, especially in the Midwood area with so many other great options around.

Always one of our best places to eat. Once a month or so we also just stop in for their black bean nachos and something to drink. Today we ordered the nachos and no more black beans, they have been replaced with pinto beans, not the same look, not the same flavor, didn't finish them. Don't order the nachos, everything else is great and the folks that work there are always welcoming and fun.
Dish was good. I had seen the episode of this spot on food network and decided to give it a shot. I would recommend swinging by if your in the area.

Dish! Don't forget about this little gem tucked away off of Central Avenue in Plaza Midwood. I always explain it as having a good southern style menu that is vegetarian and gluten free friendly. I'm mean come on they include deviled eggs with many of their dishes.  This weekend (Saturday)we stumble in and were given a breakfast menu that included mimosas and bloody marys. I don't know if this is new or just a weekend thing but I loved it! They were running a French toast special that included eggs and bacon with it for like 8 bucks! It was great.  If you have never tried one of their desserts next time you are there make sure to save room or take something to go. Their most popular is a Chocolate pecan pie with fresh whip cream.

Stopped in for an early dinner one Saturday.  I had seen the restaurant on DDD and had been wanting to visit since I moved down here.  And I finally got it on my calendar.  Things were pretty quiet when I arrived at 4:30pm.  It is apparently seat yourself as I stood at the cash register for about a minute before the hostess slid a menu across the counter and told me to seat my self.  Please don't be mad hostess lady, I would have been happy to seat myself if you had a sign...  I grabbed a table and perused the menu to pick my side.  I had already decided that I was getting the chicken and dumplings, but I didn't know what to put with it.  There are at least 15 sides for you to choose from and I settled on the squash casserole.  It took less than minutes for my food to arrive.  The chicken and dumplings were fantastic.  There was a ton of chicken and I loved the amount of black pepper in the mix (Note:  It may be a little strong for some people).  The squash casserole was not quite what I expected, but was still good.  It had a much more pureed consistency than I was expecting, but it was still pretty good.  The biscuit was okay.  Not the best biscuit I've had, but it served a purpose in scraping the bowl when I was done.  I'll come back.  I can eat that chicken and dumplings all day long.  Service was passable, nothing spectacular.  I'll sit at the counter next time.

Came here on a lunch date and this was the place he picked. I have seen it a few times when in the area but never thought to check it out for some reason. Before going I checked out other reviews up here & it seems like every food item has very mixed reviews so it didn't make my decision easy looking for what to try. He likes the chicken and dumplings so I decided to give it a try as well and I got collards as the side. It also comes with a deviled egg and honey butter biscuit. The chicken & dumplings were pretty good and is the only reason I would give the place a 2.5. The collards I took a small bite & that was enough because they didn't taste good at all. The deviled egg was very bland so I only had a bite of it and the biscuit was hard. Service was mediocre.

We decided to come here last minute for a quick weekend lunch yesterday finally! We were quickly seated by the hostess and greeted by our quirky, nice server. She gave us plenty of time to decide, everything looked good it was hard to choose. I ended up ordering the salmon patties with mac and cheese and the special hashbrown casserole of the day. The bf ordered the chicken and dumplings with a side of the infamous mashed potatoes. The food took forever to come out, my stomach was literally grumbling. But, when it did it was a lot of food. Not as piping hot as I would have liked though. The loved the consistency and size of the salmon patties, there was good seasoning in there as well but, I wish they used fresh salmon instead of canned. Would have made a huge difference. My sides were good, had to add some seasoning to the mac and cheese and the hashbrown casserole was delish. I did not like the deviled egg, it was very bland and hard to eat.   My bf really enjoyed his chicken and dumplings (not bad for 8 bucks) he however, and this is where I docked a star and a half, hated the mashed potatoes. It seems like someone smashed a potato crudely and placed it into the side cup. No seasoning or creamy component, and quite frankly it wasn't mashed with the proper smooth consistency one looks for in the traditional mashed potatoes. I had to play with it and had to add butter, salt, and pepper myself. Some cream would have been nice but, I didn't bother and just managed with what I had. Other than that, the biscuits were amazing...dirty little secret: I wanted to order more. I wasn't a fan of the white pepper gravy, I think I have been spoiled by the Flying Biscuit in this sense.   The dining room makes me want to kick back on the porch with some lemonade. Best part, our bill came out to under $20. For all that food, its worth the price. Will be back to try more.

Plaza Midwood has better restaurant options than Dish. I had heard good things about this place but I wasn't impressed. The service was slow considering that they weren't that busy. We ordered the southwestern veggies burgers and they were a bit Blah. I also ordered a side of sweet mashed potatoes. They were good but nothing to write home about. All-in-all an average dining experience. Nothing special and barely southern; just because you have something like 4 southern dishes on the menu...it is mostly American dishes though.

This is one of my favorite places in all of Charlotte to eat. The prices are amazingly low. I usually get the country-fried steak with collard greens. I love that they give you a biscuit and a deviled egg with each dinner option!
That black bean quesadilla!!!! Omg, best I've had anywhere in the world. Also, the spicy meatloaf! #Happiness

My wife and I stopped in for lunch on a recent visit to Charlotte.  We had the Fried Green Tomatoes and Parmesan Potato Poppers as an appetizer.  The tomatoes were fried to perfection and were served with a horseradish dill sauce.  The potato poppers, which I do not recall ever eating anything like them, were delicious!!  These were served with a choice of horseradish dill or parmesan peppercorn sauce.  My wife ordered the Chicken & Dumplings with a side of Smoky Lima Beans, and I ordered the Cajun Meatloaf & Mashed Potatoes with a side of Collard Greens.  The chicken & dumplings were plentiful, a really big bowl.  They were very tasty.  The meatloaf was spicy and came served with a brown gravy, which was more of a redish color than brown.  It was very tender and delicious, one of the better meatloaf's I've every had!!  Our waitress was very good, kept a good check on us.  i would recommend Dish!

Plaza Midwood is like NODA in terms of how much their clientele overrate the hell out of their restaurants....so fear not.....Dish is no different.    This place is as average as they come.  Although, in fairness, the prices are reasonable, so the value is decent.  Surprisingly, the interior was pretty nice and spacious, though. They do not cram you in like most restaurants.   If you want to grab some decent food, cheap, Dish is fine.  I just would not expect anything spectacular.

Just went to lunch here last week. I was very impressed, and my husband had a big lunch, but came with me, and Still kept eating off my plate..it was that good! I had the roast beef; every bite was great! I generally like a lighter brown gravy, but this darker gravy grew on me..it wasn't overly salty! The biscuit and my sides of mashed potatoes and mac n chz were both very good, as well. The biscuit does need a bit of honey (just ask your server for some), as most good homemade biscuits do--they are made to be a "background" to homemade jams, honey, etc that you layer on them, in the South.  Will def be back to eat at Dish, the next time we visit N.C.!

This place definitely gets 5 stars. At first glance it looks shabby and like an abandoned building (if thats anyway to explain it), but when you walk in, it looks like a country kitchen. Great atmosphere and yummy southern food, this place is perfect for lunch or dinner. I definitely recommend trying their chicken gizzards on kabobs. They are AMAZING. Every dish is served with a boiled egg, which puts spin on the dish. I work in the area, so its perfect.

I wanted to love this place.  I really did.  But things just didn't work out between us  :(  The other half and I popped in one evening recently since we were in the neighborhood.  He'd been there once before and had good things to say, so I said "heck yah man, let's go."  We both ordered the salmon patties.  Most southern establishments do a bang up job with those infamous little fish discs.   Not Dish.  They had the straaaangest flavor my taste buds have experienced in some time.  The mashed potatoes weren't MASHED, they were CLUMPED--big difference.  And oh dear Lord they were D-R-Y dry.  And to add insult to the proverbial injury, the mac-n-cheese was more like ick-n-cheese.  Clumpy.  Greasy.  Sad.  Service was also substantially lacking.  There was NO ONE in the place except for a VERY FEW people in the back bar area, so one would expect to experience no wait time or not to have to hunt down a waitress for a refill.  Not so this evening.  I think she may have come by to check on us twice (which includes her taking the order).    In summary I experienced a very broken Dish and a bad taste left in my mouth (both literally and figuratively).  Neither one of us enjoyed our meal & wasted nearly $30.  HOWEVER I am willing to give them one more try.  Maybe this was just an ''off'' day.  I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  But next time better be HELLA yummy!!!
Can't beat this place as far as comfort food is concerned. Every option is good and the service is top notch. If you miss your moms cooking, look no further. #demdumplings

Seriously amazing Southern cooking! Everything from the boiled egg, to the biscuit, pot roast, and the shrimp and grits were amazing! We also had the fried green tomatoes with the horseradish dill sauce and they were nothing short of spectacular! Service was beyond excellent and friendly! Please give this place a try! I will most definitely be back!

I love this hole in the wall place! I have never been disappointed by a dish I've gotten there (see what I did there... Pun) The staff are all very friendly and are prompt at greeting you and seating you quickly.  The homestyle vegetables are my favorite!   Parking is a hassle, but if you're lucky you can find something across the street or back behind the Post Office.

I love Dish just love it, you can read my past reviews for more info, but get the breakfast on Saturdays, it's simple and good and easy. It's gotten really busy on the weekends so you will have to wait and I've noticed  some of the staff can get annoyed on the weekends esp.if your whole party isn't there yet, but it's still worth it. Honestly, I'd take this over some other fancier breakfast places in Plaza.

YUM!  Had the pleasure of dining at Dish several times and each time did not disappoint.  There's always a huge anticipation with me and southern food... maybe because I grew up a little (more) north, so my discovery of the goodness was much later and always gives me that same feeling of dread and awesomeness every time I think about it.  My last visit, I had the cajun meatloaf.... the portion was gi-normous and I ate the entire thing (my mouth could not chew any faster).  Deviled eggs are one of my weaknesses in life.... good thing they are a side option item on the menu!  Great location, right in the heart of things off of Thomas Street.  Last time I went there were a lot of families eating (not a bad thing), but it's great to see a place that everyone can enjoy!

As a native Californian with 7 years experience in the restaurant industry, some might say my standards for food just might be on the more critical side of the spectrum.   A friend of ours recommended Dish as our first "locals" style restaurant recommendation. He's a man of few words: "Dish is pretty good. Their spicy meatloaf is excellent."   We stopped by for dinner and found some parking on the street, but I can see how parking can be hit or miss depending on the time of day and how busy the neighboring places can get.   Dish has an understated exterior, with only a colorful cartoonishly hip logo painted outside and your staple one-word trendy name. The interior is open, bright, and eclectic. Paintings and china plates are displayed on the walls. It is cozy, familiar and conjures childhood memories. The clientele is decidedly hip and young - a quick survey of the folks yielded an Ozomotoli hoodied, bearded guy, surrounded by lean women in 70's blazers and jeans. My impression - not unlike the Silverlake crowd in Southern California, understated, casual cool.   An efficient, friendly, nose-ringed waitress took our order. As prescribed, I stuck with the spicy meatloaf and mashed potatoes. My husband ordered the grits and shrimp. If you're going to eat Southern food, you gotta have some grits. Certain grits dishes can even aspire to the level of "sophisticated" cuisine; I was reminded of the well-loved shrimp and grits dish that a former Top Chef contestant whipped up that made me long for taste-o-vision.   Entrees came with a deviled egg and biscuit. While the deviled egg was satisfactory, the biscuit was mundane and a bit cold. What made up for it was the warm, well-balanced shrimp and grits, just enough salty, creamy, cheesy, taste to make you shovel the strangely textured Southern favorite into your mouth and be reduced to caveman-like sounds of affirmation and delight. The spicy meatloaf did not disappoint, an intriguing, subtle heat, slight tart and sweetness and a lovely textured meatloaf that was neither too compacted or too delicate.   Portions were perfect, pricing a good value for a sit-down restaurant that has a local hangout vibe.  My only criticism is the food temperature, which in the cool evening, dropped within minutes causing you to wonder if you could drop into the kitchen and ask to pop the dish just for a sec' into the microwave. The potatoes were a little on the dry side for my tastes, but all in all this was one of the best comfort food meals I've ever enjoyed. Simply put, I have a new-found respect for Charlotte restaurants and Southern comfort food.
Dish did not disappoint, really great food if you're in the mood for home cooking. The prices are on point as well.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! The food is so good, I haven't had one bad thing here. Everything I've had in the menu is exceptional but my favorite is the BLGT(BLT with a FRIED GREEN TOMATO!!) with a side of Mac and cheese. I dream about this food on a regular basis.

I ordered the chicken/bean burrito and my husband ordered the shrimp and grits and they were both delicious and good portion size.  The chips and salsa wasn't the best, it tasted store bought but didn't taste bad. I'll be going back!

They have good breakfast, who knew?  I must have driven by this place a zillion times (okay, that is clearly an exaggeration) , but never stopped in until one random Saturday morning after being, uhhhh... "stranded" at a "friends" house for the night.  He lived just up the street from dish, so we made our way there for breakfast.  The menu is limited, but my breakfast was excellent.  I also really enjoyed the modern decor.  I am not often in this part of town for breakfast, but it definitely has my approval.  Check it out.

I simply love this place because I feel like I've walked into a nice southern mother's kitchen prepared to eat a sensational meal. It is definitely no-frills with this place, unless you considered the Devil egg a frill, but you will never leave this place hungry or thinking you should have ordered something different.
Delicious food, nice laid back & friendly atmosphere.  Everything tastes yummy. Kinda like a mom & pop spot with a twist. I always get the pot roast dinner & I'm never disappointed.  So much flavor!

Tried this restaurant this evening.  The food was above average, as were the prices.  As we are retired and on a fixed income, it was a little out of our budget.  On the posted menu, most of the items allow for two sides, but the actual menu allows for only one.  To get another side runs almost $3 each, a little pricy.  Also, went to the restroom as we were leaving.  It has a large handicap sign on the door, an indication that it is handicap accessible.  While the size of the room is adequate, the toilet is very low to the floor.  As a handicapped person, it was difficult to get up, as the toilet is not ADA compliant.   The restaurant is located in a section of town frequented by the millennial crowd, so I found it to be a little loud for my taste.  All in all, a reasonably good  restaurant, but not one that I would go back to.  Parking was not easy to work with, either.  The negatives outweighed the positives.
